H0.text: The stern of a ship is its. Rear

H1.text: The stern of a ship is its. Aft

H2.text: The stern of a ship is its. Tail

H3.text: The stern of a ship is its. Backend

A4.text: Stern: the rear of a ship (opposite of 'bow').

A5.text: Aft: toward or at the stern of a ship, or further back from a location, e.g. 'the mizzenmast is abaft the mainmast'.

A6.text: The stern is the back or aft-most part of a ship or boat, technically defined as the area built up over the sternpost, extending upwards from the counter rail to the taffrail.

A7.text: The stern end of a ship is indicated with a white navigation light at night.

A8.text: A stern structure behind the mizzenmast and above the transom on large sailing ships

A9.text: The portion of the deck that is abaft of amidships.
